summary.para: Adds a user-defined message to the message queue and sends that message to the debug output.

param.name: Severity
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.

param.name: pDescription
param.para: The message string.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Adds a debug message to the message queue and sends that message to the debug output.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the message.

param.name: Category
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.

param.name: Severity
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.

param.name: ID
param.para: An integer that uniquely identifies the message.

param.name: pDescription
param.para: The message string.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Adds retrieval filters to the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the filters.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: An array of structures that describe the filters.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Adds storage filters to the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that produced the filters.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: An array of structures that describe the filters.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Removes a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that removes the filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Removes a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that removes the filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Clears all messages from the message queue.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that clears the messages.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Determines whether the break on a message category is turned on or off.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.

param.name: Category
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.

returns.para: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this category of breaking condition is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Determines whether the break on a message identifier is turned on or off.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.

param.name: ID
param.para: An integer value that specifies the identifier of the message.

returns.para: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this break on a message identifier is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Determines whether the break on a message severity level is turned on or off.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the breaking status.

param.name: Severity
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.

returns.para: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether this severity of breaking condition is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets a message from the message queue.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the message.

param.name: MessageIndex
param.para: An index into the message queue after an optional retrieval filter has been applied. This can be between 0 and the number of messages in the message queue that pass through the retrieval filter. Call to obtain this number. 0 is the message at the beginning of the message queue.

param.name: pMessage
param.para: A pointer to a structure that describes the message.

param.name: pMessageByteLength
param.para: A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the message description that pMessage points to. This size includes the size of the structure in bytes.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: This method doesn't remove any messages from the message queue.
This method gets a message from the message queue after an optional retrieval filter has been applied.
Call this method twice to retrieve a message, first to obtain the size of the message and second to get the message. Here is a typical example:
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the maximum number of messages that can be added to the queue. –1 means no limit.

remarks.para: When the number of messages in the message queue reaches the maximum limit, new messages coming in push old messages out.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Determines whether the debug output is turned on or off.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the mute status.

returns.para: Returns a Boolean value that specifies whether the debug output is turned on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the number of messages that a storage filter allowed to pass through.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the number of messages allowed by a storage filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the number of messages that were denied passage through a storage filter.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the number of messages denied by a storage filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the number of messages that were discarded due to the message count limit.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the number of messages that were discarded.

remarks.para: Get and set the message count limit with and , respectively.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the number of messages currently stored in the message queue.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the number of messages currently stored in the message queue.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the number of messages that can pass through a retrieval filter.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the number.

returns.para: Returns the number of messages that can pass through a retrieval filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the retrieval filter at the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the filter.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.

param.name: pFilterByteLength
param.para: A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the filter description to which pFilter points. If pFilter is NULL, GetRetrievalFilter outputs the size of the retrieval filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the size.

returns.para: Returns the size of the retrieval-filter stack in bytes.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the storage filter at the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the filter.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.

param.name: pFilterByteLength
param.para: A pointer to a variable that receives the size, in bytes, of the filter description to which pFilter points. If pFilter is NULL, GetStorageFilter outputs the size of the storage filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Gets the size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the size.

returns.para: Returns the size of the storage-filter stack in bytes.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pops a retrieval filter from the top of the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pops the filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pops a storage filter from the top of the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pops the filter.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a copy of the retrieval filter that is currently on the top of the retrieval-filter stack onto the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the copy of the retrieval filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a copy of the storage filter that is currently on the top of the storage-filter stack onto the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the copy of the storage filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a deny-all retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the deny-all retrieval filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: A deny-all retrieval filter prevents all messages from passing through.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a deny-all storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: A deny-all storage filter prevents all messages from passing through.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes an empty retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the empty retrieval filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: An empty retrieval filter allows all messages to pass through.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes an empty storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the empty storage filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: An empty storage filter allows all messages to pass through.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a retrieval filter onto the retrieval-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Pushes a storage filter onto the storage-filter stack.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that pushes the filter.

param.name: pFilter
param.para: A pointer to a structure that describes the filter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Sets a message category to break on when a message with that category passes through the storage filter.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.

param.name: Category
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the category of the message.

param.name: bEnable
param.para: A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnCategory turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Sets a message identifier to break on when a message with that identifier passes through the storage filter.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.

param.name: ID
param.para: An integer value that specifies the identifier of the message.

param.name: bEnable
param.para: A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnID turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Sets a message severity level to break on when a message with that severity level passes through the storage filter.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the breaking condition.

param.name: Severity
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the severity of the message.

param.name: bEnable
param.para: A Boolean value that specifies whether SetBreakOnSeverity turns on or off this breaking condition (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Sets the maximum number of messages that can be added to the message queue.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that sets the limit on the number of messages.

param.name: MessageCountLimit
param.para: The maximum number of messages that can be added to the queue. –1 means no limit.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; an error code otherwise. For a list of error codes, see DXGI_ERROR.

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: Turns the debug output on or off.

param.name: Producer
param.para: A DXGI_DEBUG_ID value that identifies the entity that gets the mute status.

param.name: bMute
param.para: A Boolean value that specifies whether to turn the debug output on or off (TRUE for on, FALSE for off).

remarks.para: Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.

summary.para: This interface controls the debug information queue, and can only be used if the debug layer is turned on.

remarks.para: This interface is obtained by calling the function.
For more info about the debug layer, see Debug Layer.
Note This API requires the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 8.
